verses.verse: Announcement of the Messiah’s Reign A Psalm of David. [1] The (Matt. 22:44; Mark 12:36; 16:19; Luke 20:42, 43; Acts 2:34, 35; Col. 3:1; Heb. 1:13) LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, Till I make Your enemies Your ((1 Cor. 15:25; Eph. 1:22)) footstool.”
The LORD shall send the rod of Your strength ((Rom. 11:26, 27)) out of Zion. ((Ps. 2:9; Dan. 7:13, 14)) Rule in the midst of Your enemies!
(Judg. 5:2; Neh. 11:2) Your people shall be volunteers In the day of Your power; (1 Chr. 16:29; Ps. 96:9) In the beauties of holiness, from the womb of the morning, You have the dew of Your youth.
The LORD has sworn And ((Num. 23:19)) will not relent, “You are a ((Zech. 6:13)) priest forever According to the order of ((Heb. 5:6, 10; 6:20)) Melchizedek.”
The Lord is ((Ps. 16:8)) at Your right hand; He shall execute kings (Ps. 2:5, 12; (Rom. 2:5; Rev. 6:17)) in the day of His wrath.
He shall judge among the nations, He shall fill the places with dead bodies, (Ps. 68:21) He shall execute the heads of many countries.
He shall drink of the brook by the wayside; ((Is. 53:12)) Therefore He shall lift up the head.
